headline: Air Products and Chemicals Inc (APD) Q1 2026 Earnings Call Highlights: Strong EPS Growth Amidst ...
summary: Air Products and Chemicals Inc (APD) reports a 10% increase in EPS and a 12% rise in adjusted operating income, while navigating helium headwinds and capital expenditure challenges.

headline: Air Products APD Q1 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Eduardo Menezes: Thank you, Megan.  Earnings per share were $3.16, up 10% relative to the prior year on stronger productivity despite weak economic conditions.  In that time, we have taken significant actions to refocus on the core industrial gas business, including project cancellations, head count optimization and asset rationalization that are showing up in our results.

headline: Air Products and Chemicals (APD) Q1 Earnings and Revenues Surpass Estimates
summary: Air Products and Chemicals (APD) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +3.91% and +1.90%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Air Products Posts Higher Profit, Revenue on Pricing
summary: Air Products and Chemicals logged higher profit and revenue in its fiscal first quarter, boosted in part by higher prices that stemmed from increased energy costs.

headline: Air Products beats Q1 expectations, shares rise on strong base business
summary: Investing.com -- Air Products and Chemicals Inc (NYSE:APD) reported first quarter fiscal 2026 adjusted earnings on Friday that exceeded analyst expectations, driven by strong performance in its base business despite headwinds in helium demand.

headline: Air Products and Chemicals: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The Allentown, Pennsylvania-based company said it had profit of $3.04 per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, came to $3.16 per share. The results beat Wall Street expectations.

raw.headline: Air Products and Chemicals: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: The Allentown, Pennsylvania-based company said it had profit of $3.04 per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, came to $3.16 per share. The results beat Wall Street expectations.

headline: Air Products Reports Fiscal 2026 First Quarter Results
summary: Air Products (NYSE:APD) today reported first quarter fiscal 2026 GAAP operating income of $735 million, up 14 percent from the prior year, primarily due to favorable business mix, non‑helium pricing, net of power and fuel costs, and lower costs. The lower costs include productivity improvements and lower maintenance, partially offset by fixed-cost inflation and the prior year sale of a U.S. equity method investment.
